title: Wonderful stay, great room, great food
text:
We stayed in the Tower room, right at the top of the castle for one night. Room was wonderfully themed and comfortable in all aspects. Only book this room if you want to climb around 6 flights of stairs though!
The restaurant meal was delicious. Friendly waiting staff too. Would definitely return.

title: Over-priced room, but great view, great staff and food
text:
We stayed for one night in a castle view room at ¬£180 B and B.
The room had a great view but was tired. It smelt when we first entered and we had to air it for a while. Fixtures and fittings were tired, Eg. Fraying carpet and no grout in bathroom floor tiles. The shower had previous occupants hair in it. Would have expected more for ¬£180.
However, restaurant staff and food were both top notch. Dinner and breakfast were delicious. The waiter Macually was happy, pleasant and couldn‚Äôt help enough.
Completely Covid safe (despite previous comments). We have only marked as average purely on price.

title: Another great visit üòÅ
text:
Our second stay here, this time in the King James Suite. We had an offer to include afternoon tea, dinner and breakfast (we paid a little extra to stop in the suite).
Afternoon tea was delicious and plentiful. Staff were helpful.
Dinner was superb and our raised dining area fantastic. Food was faultless as were the staff.
Breakfast the next day provided everything we wanted to eat. All table service re Covid, but we wanted for nothing. Would recommend anyone to stay here for a slightly different hotel experience in a castle dating back to the 1300‚Äôs.

title: Definitely worth a visit
text: An impressive castle well worth the visit. Plenty of indoor rooms with antiques, coats of armour etc to look at, and lots of outdoor areas to explore. We spent 3.5 hours here, it did help we had a wonderful sunny, dry day, but well worth the entrance fee.

title: Delicious food, attentive service
text: We stayed at the hotel and enjoyed dinner in Black Knights. We found the staff very attentive and helpful. Delicious food and wine. Will return when next in the area.

title: Clean, value for money hotel
text:
We stayed for one night in a room with a balcony. Newly fitted out, perfectly adequate.
Nice bar on site, great Wi-fi (for watching sports on iPad!), although they do have sky sports too!
Lovely on site Thai restaurant.
Great value for money.

title: Good fun great challenges
text: Our first escape room and really good fun. Challenging but not too much so you can‚Äôt proceed through the rooms. Thanks to Alisha who was really helpful.

title: So much to do
text: A great place with so much to see and do. Gets a bit crowded but seems to be one of the main attractions. A must when in key west.

title: Plenty to do
text:
A lovely port with lots of shopping opportunities. Plenty of restaurants and bars too.
There are dolphins pools where you can have a dolphin experience and flamingoes to view and photograph. Plenty to do if you don‚Äôt want to go on an excursion.

title: Very large and a little dated
text: The casino is really very large with lots of slots and tables. A great place to explore and lose some money! My partner found one table (two members of staff) very rude. It was though they didn‚Äôt want him to play, didn‚Äôt want his bets and queried his bets! For this reason we would take our money to another casino. What a shame!

title: Lots of choice!
text: A great location full of shops, restaurants etc. Lots of choice and no pushy selling from anyone. Worth a look.

title: Tubing on the white river
text: We can not recommend this enough! So much fun to be on the river for around an hour. The hosts were helpful and cheerful and the whole excursion was safe and well organised. Do not hesitate, book!

title: Beautiful scenery
text: We took a trip by boat around a section of the lake and saw a variety of birds and animals. Beautiful setting and so much to see.

title: Take an excursion
text: Take an organised tour. Colon seems a very sad town (seen through the bus windows only passing through to our excursion area) that looked derelict in many areas. Doesn‚Äôt seem to have had investment which is a shame given the number of cruise passengers arriving at Colon.

title: Impressive
text: Old and impressive. Worth a photo stop but not sure about the walk to the top, although great views we were told if you do. Lots of vendors trying to sell their souvenirs and a very busy area with so many tourists.
place: Castillo de San Felipe de Barajas

title: Nice old town, lots to see
text: This was a lovely old town with lots of narrow streets full of restaurants, bars and shops. Easy to spend hours just taking in the hustle and bustle. Definitely worth wandering around in the heat!

title: Great Location
text:
We stayed for one night mid cruises. The employee who greeted us kindly checked us in slightly early - thank you. We had a room overlooking the cruise terminals and bay. It was the best view.
The room was tired, but everything was clean and tidy and we would stay again purely for location. It is a 2 minute walk to Bayside shopping and restaurants, and 5 minutes to some banks/shops (including Ross clothes store).
Breakfast was great with a big selection and great fresh fruit.
place: Holiday Inn Port of Miami Downtown

title: Slow service
text: We went for drinks and intended to have food too, but the service was slow so we moved on. We were served drinks in glasses which you take home with you, but without being asked first. Obviously this comes with a large extra charge. It was a bit of a trouble getting it taken off the bill.

title: Good location, good price
text:
We stayed for 3 nights in a room with a large balcony. Good room but little light. Only lamps and ‚Äòmood lighting‚Äô. The flooring was ‚Äòdifferent‚Äô, not carpet or tile, but a plastic covering type, like a wipeable placemat?
Bathroom was large, modern and clean. We had everything we needed in the room and were comfortable in it. The continental breakfast was more than adequate and the room never packed full, which was good. Good fresh fruit options, lots of berries.
Close to the Bayside shopping/restaurants, so no hire car needed. On location only would stay again, but good price and helpful staff help.
place: The Gabriel Miami, Curio Collection by Hilton

title: Great outlet stores
text: We visited for a few hours but could have stayed all day. Lots of branded outlet stores so cheap designer items for UK visitors. Loads of bars and restaurants too, so literally could have spent the day at Dolphin Mall.

title: Great service
text: Great service and lots of tables outside in the sunshine and shaded areas. A standard HRC, but with great view of the Bayside marina area, lots of yachts to watch. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Great day out
text: So many shops and restaurants to choose from. Definitely a great place to book a hotel near as you could spend hours here.

title: Superb customer service from Julio
text:
We are gold members and asked if we could check in a little early. We had booked the whirlpool suite but this was not ready, as we were so tired his offer of a junior suite was accepted quickly! We had got off a cruise early. Julio was more than helpful and friendly and accommodating. We have stayed at so many Hilton hotels and he is a credit to this hotel.

Junior suite was great and we had a very comfortable stay. Cleanliness was excellent, bed was great, large and comfy.

Breakfast was plentiful and delicious.

Will stay again when in Miami.

Thanks Julio for making our check in day so much easier with your friendly happy service
place: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Miami Airport & Convention Center

title: Excellent and convenient
text:
We booked this trip online prior to our cruise stopping at Athens for the day, as we did not want a crowded coach tour trip losing time moving around as a large group. We also wanted to make our own choices about what to see. Also as there were 4 of us, it also made good economics based on the excursion costs from the cruise line.
What a great decision it was.
Visali was our driver, and although not a tour guide (we don‚Äôt think?), was friendly helpful and told us lots about the area, the sights and some history.
He met us at the cruise terminal holding a board with our names and we walked a couple of minutes to our large, comfortable minibus (just for us 4!). We had previously told the company where we wanted to go but I understand you can more or less set your own itinerary and timings if you want. We had also pre booked online tickets for the Acropolis which saved us a little bit of time when we got there, but the queues at the ticket offices were not as scary as the online information suggested (we visited around 4pm).
Visali took us where we wanted to go and gave us a spare mobile phone to use, to ring him when we had finished at an attraction and wanted to move on. He provided chilled bottled water too.
It was a brilliant day and I would not hesitate to recommend this company or Visali.

title: Lovely building
text: Located right in the middle of the old town, this is a very impressive building. Steeped in history from the 11th century I understand. Worth a look.

title: A must see
text:
Another must see if in Athens.
You can see most of the stadium from outside (without paying the ‚Ç¨5 fee to get in) but it‚Äôs so worth the entrance fee. We climbed to the top of the steps and my partner just had to run a lap in this historic stadium.
Not crowded either.

title: Stunning
text:
A must see in Athens. Stunning views and monuments.
We visited around 4pm and it was very very busy. Trainers are a must as there are some slippy stones which are unavoidable and very uneven ground in some places. Take bottled water - it‚Äôs a good uphill trudge.

title: Worth a bisot
text: Lots of little streets with bars, shops and restaurants and some historic buildings. Definitely worth a look.

title: Worth seeing
text: A very short walk from the Little Venice area. Worth going to see whilst on the island as a nice photo opportunity.

title: Quick and easy
text:
A ‚Ç¨6 trip which was well worth it and much more preferable to walking up and down the steps where there are donkeys.
Great views.

title: Slippy, with the risk of being trampled by donkeys
text:
We decided it was a nice day to amble down the many steps, but what a mistake!
It was a difficult long walk avoiding ‚Äòherds‚Äô of donkeys, (either being sent down the steps unsupervised (to get back to the bottom to pick up more tourists) or walking up in groups of around 5/10 donkeys in a convoy) and the surface was very slippery. Completely unsuitable for anyone unfit or without trainers. The donkeys would walk where they liked, forcing everyone to hug the wall to avoid being trampled on! Mother in law slipped and is heavily bruised with suspected broken rib! She had good trainers on and is pretty fit.
Some parts covered in donkey bodily waste!
Think carefully before you start this walk!

title: Great food, great coffee, good serbice
text:
We wasted several hours waiting for our flight in this wine bar, eating main course and dessert and drinking wine and coffee.
The food was delicious and we loved the photographs in the menus.
The salads are stunning and big portions.
We had no problems with service and would definitely visit again.

title: Ok stay, amazing breakfast!
text:
We stayed for one night in a large, clean room. All good in the room but very noisy in the hallway from 1-3am with people returning to rooms. My partner got hardly any sleep. Maybe nothing to do with the hotel or maybe the room location?

Great location overall, opposite the bay. Lots of free parking.

The breakfast was up there with the best. We were first in the room and everything was perfect, gleaming and so clean. The presentation of the breakfast room was just top end, whoever looks after this is very very good at their job. Food was also top notch with lots of choices and the coffee was a quality one.

title: Convenient location
text:
We stayed for two nights. The room was clean but the bedding and bathroom could do with upgrades. The price we paid was higher than the price advertised outside the hotel, so a little disappointing.
We found little choice in this area for hotels so would stay again purely for location and convenience. The receptionist who checked us in was very helpful and friendly.

title: Nice place
text: This is definitely worth a visit if you don‚Äôt want the long round trip to Berlin, (from your cruise ship). Lots of interesting small little streets, restaurants shops and bars.

title: Old fashioned town
text: We spent a good few hours walking around the old town which is full of small, narrow streets, restaurants, bars and shops. A really interesting visit and lots to see.

title: Stunning
text: Absolutely stunning and well worth the visit. It‚Äôs a shame that scaffolding was on part of the building whilst we were there, but this did not detract too much. Queues were pretty long to visit.
place: Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood

title: Hassle free parking and stay, as always
text:
Still remains our favourite park and fly hotel due to its close location to T5 and the quality of stay and service. Reception staff helpful and friendly.
Airport transfer via Hoppa H57 bus is around ¬£20 for 2, return, and bus picks up directly outside hotel.
Rooms are comfortable, and executive lounge good, offering a happy hour for food and drinks.
Easy access from M25.

title: Impressive!
text: We spent a good couple of hours here as the ship was so impressive. The museum is on several floors with many different themed areas. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Perfect location, very comfortable hotel
text:
Stayed due to proximity to airport (access takes a few minutes via a covered walkway) and it was the perfect decision.
Very comfortable bed, clean contemporary room. Helpful, friendly staff. Would stay again if in Copenhagen.

title: Very tasty, great, quick service üòÅ
text:
We visited 3 times whilst on holiday because the curries were so delicious. Really tasty food with no scrimping on spices. Great service and prices. Will definitely return if back in the area.
(They also have a Mexican menu option).
place: Red chilli indian & maxican restaurant playamar torremolinos

title: Water taxi to paradise idland
text: We took this taxi at $4 each from the cruise port to paradise island. It seemed that they waited and waited for the boat to be as full as possible and not just full but rammed full, ie no space to move when sat down. We waited for ages for the boat to move off. The ride took 15 minutes approx and was fairly pleasant with good views of the cruise ships in port.

title: Amazingly clear blue sea üåä
text: We visited here for relaxation and were not disappointed. The beach was not crowded and plenty of room for sunbathing. The sea was absolutely beautiful, again not crowded and the water was crystal clear.

title: Fantastic stay
text: All good here. Nice new rooms, helpful staff, great breakfast (thanks for the 10 minute warning it was finishing - lots of hotels don‚Äôt bother to tell you) and a nice bar and restaurant area. Would definitely stay again if in the area.

title: Beautiful buildongs
text: Very impressive buildings, but we didn‚Äôt have time to tour inside. The outside street is lined with bronze statues of presidents. A really well kept area worth a look.

title: Beautiful place
text:
We spent a sunny, hot day here. The fortress and its grounds were very impressive and a real must see!
The cruise ships dock so close to the city you don‚Äôt really need an excursion if you just want to see the city. You could easily run out of time!

title: Varied market
text:
Lots of vendors, lots of fruit and vegetables. Quite a basic set up, lots of litter etc...
One reviewer said cruise passengers just walked around and didn‚Äôt buy anything from the stall owners, But that‚Äôs because you are not allowed to take any food or drink back on board, so can only look! Interesting to do so though!

title: Nice location, great shops
text: We docked at Amber Cove for a day and it was a great port... bars and restaurants, coffee shop, a small Souvenir market and many shops. There is a swimming pool with sun beds so you could just relax. When we stopped it was a cloudy day and rained for an hour, but still really hot. The pool area would have been great for a sunny day.

title: Segway toir
text:
This company provides Segway tours and we were booked with only 2 others in the group so we had great service.
The tour lasted about an hour and we went to the most amazing beach and through the town. Water was provided and an interesting commentary. We would definitely do again.

title: Worth doing if you are time limited
text:
We did the trolley tour because we were time limited and wanted to see as much as we could, so the $80 for two was worth it. It is a hop on hop off tour, and goes all around the island although some stops are just hotel pick ups.
Would do again without doubt.
place: Old Town Trolley Tours Key West

title: Great, busy location
text: So many restaurants and bars, we are just sorry we didn‚Äôt have more time. Plenty of shops, tourist attractions... seems to be the happening place. It is very touristy but that‚Äôs what we went for! would like to go back one day.

title: Busy, busy, busy
text:
A must see really, but so many people waiting to have photographs taken. We didn‚Äôt queue but have seen the southernmost point! Would the photo have been worth queuing? Probably not.
Probably best to go really early!

title: Christmas Day cocktails in the sun!
text: We stopped here on Xmas day for drinks and snacks, and sat outside watching the world go by on Duval Street. We had great nachos, great service and good fun. Would stop by again but so many other Hard Rock Cafes to visit first!

title: Fantastic beach, good service
text:
We spent several hours here one afternoon. Crystal clear water and beautiful tropical sand.
Sun beds and umbrellas available as was a bar, restaurant and drinks service. A great beach club to visit.

title: Fun, scenic and rum!
text:
We paid around $120 each for a trip around the island on this double decker train. The bottom carriages are enclosed, the top open air. The journey was around 2 hours through scenic countryside with sea views. The weather was beautiful and we needed the breeze we got.
When we first boarded and the train set off, it was rickety with much movement, we actually thought it would be an endurance test, however the more rum we had (included), the less the movement bothered us
We only had around 15 people in our carriage so plenty of room.
We would not do the trip again, but would definitely recommend to first time visitors.

title: Fantastic day out
text:
A very worthwhile visit. We were given a talk with/about parrots, saw turtles, Sea lions, tortoises, fed sting ray.......
We had a guided tour of the park and visited the underwater viewing area where we saw lots of different types of fish.
There is a gift shop, cafe and it‚Äôs a 2 minute walk to the beach. Well worth a visit.

title: Location is great if you have no hire car
text:
Stayed for one night following a cruise. Hotel is huge and busy.
We arrived very early (check in wasn‚Äôt until 4pm), but managed to get our room earlier. Special thanks to Cynthia on the front desk for being so helpful.
Rooms are a bit tired but clean and adequate. There is not an in room safe.
The location is superb and lots of shopping, restaurants and bars are all within walking distance. For this reason alone we would stay again without hesitation.
place: Embassy Suites by Hilton Fort Lauderdale 17th Street

title: Very average
text:
We booked a couple of nights here mid cruises. We had one of the suites which had a patio over looking the pool. The first suite we were given had no sun whatsoever on the patio (it was the sun we were looking for, hence booking this room), but front desk staff moved us. When we first asked (by phone) we were told there was no other room available, but when we visited the front desk, there was one available. Pleased to say this one got sun from around noon (The Key West Suite).
Room was tired and furniture/carpets were worn and stained.
There was a large group of teenagers/young adults partying at the pool each day from early morning to evening. Not the hotel‚Äôs fault but it was non stop shouting and screeching.
The pool gets very little sun btw (Dec) so I wouldn‚Äôt book this hotel unless you want shade.
We wouldn‚Äôt stay again.

title: Great value for money. A cheap option for Gatwick parking
text:
We stayed here for one night before flying out and for half a day upon our return with 20 days parking. The cost was ¬£160 for all. I priced up an airport hotel with parking and for exactly the same deal and we would have paid over ¬£500 for an on site four star.
Little foxes is a cheap and cheerful option, very close to the airport with onsite parking (you leave your car key with the staff). The rooms are old and could do with updating, but the competitive price and parking costs are the attractions.
Rooms are clean, staff are helpful. Would definitely return based on cost alone.
